meanings.definition: Lacking in physical attractiveness; plain or unattractive.
meanings.sent1: The old house on the corner looked homelier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the homelier style of clothing over flashy outfits.
meanings.sent3: The homelier sweater made her look like a cozy grandma.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the sleek sports car, the old truck seemed homelier.
meanings.sent5: The homelier room with its worn furniture felt more inviting than the fancy one.

meanings.definition: Of or characteristic of the home or family; domestic.
meanings.sent1: The homelier atmosphere of the small cafe reminded him of home.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the homelier feel of the countryside compared to the city.
meanings.sent3: The homelier chores like washing dishes always made her feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The homelier traditions of baking cookies together brought the family closer.
meanings.sent5: The homelier scent of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with warmth.
